radiographic_examinations.findings: Generalized osteopenia and symmetric bowing of the long bones, mainly affecting the lower limbs. All long bones appeared short and were characterized by markedly splayed and fragmented metaphyses and mildly broadened diaphyses with evidence for persistent cartilaginous remnants within the growth plates.
Z scores at the spine (L2 â€“L4) for patients D2 and D1 were -2.40 and -2.66, respectively. The Z scores for whole-body bone mineral content were -0.47 and -1.59.
